meanings.definition: The quality or state of being semipermeable.
meanings.sent1: The semipermeabilities of the membrane determine what can pass through.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the semipermeabilities of different materials to understand their properties.
meanings.sent3: The semipermeabilities of the wall were so selective, even the ants couldn't get through!
meanings.sent4: Her mind had semipermeabilities, allowing only positive thoughts to enter.
meanings.sent5: The semipermeabilities of the filter were so precise, only the tiniest particles could pass.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a membrane or barrier allows certain substances to pass through while blocking others.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the semipermeabilities of the cell membrane is crucial for biology students.
meanings.sent2: The semipermeabilities of the screen door let in the breeze but kept out the bugs.
meanings.sent3: The semipermeabilities of the cheese grater were put to the test when it blocked the large chunks of cheese.
meanings.sent4: The semipermeabilities of the castle walls allowed only the bravest knights to enter.
meanings.sent5: The semipermeabilities of the umbrella kept the rain out while letting the light shine through.
